citation.article-title: Catellibacterium nectariphilum gen. nov., sp. nov., which requires a diffusible compound from a strain related to the genus Sphingomonas for vigorous growth
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Catellibacterium (Ca.tel.li.bac.te′ri.um. L. n. catella a small chain; N.L. neut. n. bacterium from Gr. n. bakterion a small rod; N.L. neut. n. Catellibacterium a chained small rod).
Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-motile, ovoid to rod-shaped cells, growing in pairs and chains.
No growth under anaerobic conditions either by fermentation, nitrate reduction or phototrophy.
Indole production from tryptophan, nitrate reduction and gelatin hydrolysis are negative.
Arginine dihydrolase, urease and β-glucosidase activities are absent.
Growth occurs under mesophilic and neutrophilic conditions.
The major cellular fatty acid is C18 : 1cis11.
DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 64·5 mol% (by HPLC).
Ubiquinone-10 is the major component of the quinone system.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis places the genus in the α-3 subclass of Proteobacteria.
The type species is Catellibacterium nectariphilum.
